answers.answer: At 20wks my baby was measuring 13oz my ob didn't say anything about him being too big
Its fine ! The app just gives you a proximity of what your baby should weigh, not all babies are the same (:
Okay thanks. But am I making my baby big by what I'm eating? Or does it really matter? I shouldn't be concerned right?
Mine was 12oz at 20wks and dr said it was spot on average. This apps weight are a bit whacky.
If their weight reflected off of what we ate..i would have had a huge kid. I ate cheeseburgers all the time.Baby will take whatever food and nutrients it needs.

My best advice is to NEVER listen to what friends,colleagues and strangers say..they are not experts and even if they may have been pregnant and have a few kids, doesn't mean they KNOW what is normal for you and not.Some girls make large babies, some small.. it is just like when you look around.. some people are tall, some short, some fat, some skinny..As long as you are eating healthy and your doctor is happy with your results you should have no reason to worry.If you still are worried though, ask your doctor if you can be tested for Gestational Diabetes in week 26.You'll not be able to test earlier unfortunately due to hormone levels.It could be that your body fails to produce enough insulin and sends too much sugar to your baby -and then your baby grows too much.But just eat healthy and you should have no reason to worry.Good luck!
My son was measuring 14oz at my 20 week.
At my last ultrasound (27/4 weeks) my boy weighed 3lb 2 oz. My first born weigh 3lb 5 oz at 30 weeks. I'm anxious to c what he weighs when I go on the 10th for an ultrasound I'll b 32/4.

question: Okay according to this app my baby should be 9oz at 20 weeks. Well when I went to the Dr this week they said my baby was 12oz. Is that big? I uploaded my baby ultrasound pic on social network and 2 people said he is huge. So is my baby really big? Btw I posted the pic on this site too if you guys wanted to look
title: big baby?
